docs.lead_paragraph: The couple were married on Feb. 2 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. The bride wore a white baseball cap with an attached veil for their 40-second ceremony, and clutched yellow tulips.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some high-level Democrats are betting that the outcome of President Obama's health care summit meeting this week could hinge on the extent to which they prove to the American public that they have already incorporated Republican ideas into the Democrats' health care legislation. Making that case, the Democrats believe, could establish political legitimacy for pressing ahead with a combined version of the bills adopted late last year by the House and Senate, even if Congressional Republicans continue to oppose the measures.

headline.main: Hoping to Show The G.O.P.'s Role

docs.abstract: Some high-level Democrats believe they will make their case for health care overhaul at White House summit meeting if they can prove they have incorporated Republican ideas into legislation; Republicans oppose bulk of Democrats' two existing bills and are rejecting some of their own previous ideas; are increasingly confident of having upper hand amid opinion polls showing growing public unease with overhaul; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: ...then I'd have to pay for them, more each year.  But that's not the case, so I welcome your thoughts on my Sunday column, which explores what would happen if journalism were like health care. I got the idea from other parallel efforts, such as Jonathan Rauch's brilliant essay comparing health with airlines.

headline.main: If Your Comments Were Like Health Care...

docs.abstract: A few thoughts, and comments, on my Sunday column examining what would happen if journalism were like our unreformed health care system.

docs.lead_paragraph: Moved to action by the proposed Anthem Blue Cross premium increases, Senator Dianne Feinstein, Democrat of California, said Friday that she would introduce legislation to create a "national Medical Insurance Rate Authority" to prevent unfair rate increases by private insurers.

headline.main: Feinstein to Propose Federal Supervision of Insurance Rates

docs.abstract: Amid controversy over a California insurer's proposed rate increase, Senator Dianne Feinstein said Friday she would offer legislation creating a federal panel with authority to review and cancel premium increases in some states.
docs.snippet: Amid controversy over a California insurer's proposed rate increase, Senator Dianne Feinstein said Friday she would offer legislation creating a federal panel with authority to review and cancel premium increases in some states.

docs.lead_paragraph: "Ask an Expert" is a recurring feature on Bucks where you have the opportunity to question big-brained individuals about a particular area of personal finance or consumer affairs.

docs.lead_paragraph: As health care reform continues to twist in the wind, the problems of the current system continue to become more apparent. It is not hard to find anecdotal evidence of small businesses whose insurance rates have jumped 20 or 30 percent. Here's an article about small-business rate increases from October. Here's an article from today's paper about the recent explosion in insurance rates, especially in California but in other states as well.
